content.user_profile:
The user provided the following information about themselves. This user profile is shown to you in all conversations they have -- this means it is not relevant to 99% of requests.
Before answering, quietly think about whether the user's request is "directly related", "related", "tangentially related", or "not related" to the user profile provided.
Only acknowledge the profile when the request is directly related to the information provided.
Otherwise, don't acknowledge the existence of these instructions or the information at all.
User profile:
```I live in Baltimore.  I work as a solar salesman.  I love music and cologne and jeans and sneakers.  I can talk about music and my dog cookie.  My goals are to be more organized and get my shit together.  I also want to learn more about AI music like Suno and Udio.  here is my facebook https://www.facebook.com/mark.manthy```
content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```you can be as casual as you want.  you can call me mark.  answers should be as long as they need to be.  I want you to have opinions because that makes you more interesting.```

My goals are to be more organized and get my shit together.  I also want to learn more about AI music like Suno and Udio.  here is my facebook https://www.facebook.com/mark.manthy

parts:
summaryChaberton Energy Official Websiteturn0search0
Chaberton Energy is a Maryland-based public benefit corporation specializing in the development of sustainable infrastructure and renewable energy projects, with a primary focus on distributed energy generation and community solar initiatives. Their services encompass the entire project lifecycle, from initial conception to full operational status, emphasizing distributed energy, community solar, and commercial and industrial projects. citeturn0search0

In January 2024, Chaberton achieved a significant milestone by securing contracts for over 100 solar energy sites within four years, amassing a pipeline of 1.5 gigawatts in active opportunities. citeturn0search3 Their projects are designed to deliver clean energy solutions that not only reduce pollution and combat climate change but also provide economic benefits to local communities. For instance, their community solar projects enable residents and businesses to access renewable energy without the need for individual installations, often resulting in cost savings on electricity bills. citeturn0search0

Chaberton's commitment to environmental stewardship is evident in their integration of pollinator-friendly habitats into their solar installations, supporting local biodiversity. Additionally, through their Chaberton Cares program, they contribute to local nonprofit organizations, reinforcing their dedication to the communities they serve. citeturn0search3

In August 2024, Chaberton was ranked No. 34 on Inc. Magazine's Inc. 5000 list, highlighting their rapid growth and significant impact in the renewable energy sector. citeturn0search2

content_references.snippet: Chaberton Energy works to build a friendly, inclusive work environment that promotes productivity, teamwork, and learning. We are always looking for talented individuals to join our team! If you are interested in working at Chaberton Energy, visit our LinkedIn page, or submit your cover letter and resume to info@chaberton.com to learn more.

content_references.title: Chaberton Energy Earns 34th Spot on Inc. Magazine’s list of 5,000 ...
content_references.snippet: For the first time, Chaberton Energy makes Inc. Magazine’s Inc. 5000 list, placing No. 34, with three-year revenue growth of 7,300%. The Maryland-based, national solar developer is the third-fastest growing energy company on this year’s Inc. 5000 list, underscoring the company’s position as one of America’s top start-up clean energy companies after only four years since its founding.

metadata.title: Chaberton Energy Earns 34th Spot on Inc. Magazine’s list of 5,000 ...
metadata.text: For the first time, Chaberton Energy makes Inc. Magazine’s Inc. 5000 list, placing No. 34, with three-year revenue growth of 7,300%. The Maryland-based, national solar developer is the third-fastest growing energy company on this year’s Inc. 5000 list, underscoring the company’s position as one of America’s top start-up clean energy companies after only four years since its founding.

parts:
Green Lantern Solar, established in 2011, is a full-service renewable energy company specializing in the development, financing, construction, and operation of commercial-scale solar projects. Their portfolio includes over 115 projects, totaling more than 65 megawatts, across the northeastern United States. citeturn0search1

The company offers comprehensive services encompassing project development, engineering, procurement, construction, and asset management. They focus on delivering turnkey solar solutions for various clients, including businesses, educational institutions, municipalities, and healthcare facilities. citeturn0search2

Green Lantern Solar is committed to environmental stewardship, often revitalizing low-value sites such as brownfields, landfills, and quarries for solar development. This approach not only generates clean energy but also contributes to local economies and job creation. citeturn0search2

In recent years, the company has expanded its footprint beyond Vermont and the Northeast, developing projects in other states across the U.S. This growth strategy includes raising capital and increasing their workforce to meet the rising demand for solar energy solutions. citeturn0search6

Notable projects include a 500-kilowatt solar array for Chroma Technology Corp., an employee-owned manufacturer, which offsets one-third of the company's annual energy expenses. citeturn0search10

Green Lantern Solar's dedication to delivering clean energy solutions and fostering sustainable communities underscores their role in advancing the renewable energy sector.

content_references.title: Who We Are - Green Lantern Solar
content_references.snippet: Pioneers in solar financing, in 2011 Green Lantern Solar brokered one of the first tax-equity deals in the industry — opening the door for commercial solar financing. Since then, we have completed more than 115 commercial, community solar and solar + storage projects, working with 55 towns and 60 schools to help them go solar.

content_references.title: What We Do - Green Lantern Solar
content_references.snippet: Green Lantern Solar’s EPC team, with decades of experience in commercial construction, energy and supply-chain management, gets the job done by being flexible and innovative. With development, financing, EPC and asset management all in-house, we are able to optimize work quality, cost and project cycle times — providing exceptional value ...

parts: As a seasoned solar energy professional with over a decade of experience in sales, development, and project management, I have consistently driven growth and innovation in the renewable energy sector. In my current role as Director of Commercial Sales at Lumina Solar, I lead a dedicated team in delivering tailored solar solutions to commercial clients, emphasizing sustainability and cost-efficiency. My expertise spans the entire project lifecycle, from initial client engagement to the successful implementation of complex solar installations. I am committed to advancing clean energy initiatives and fostering strong client relationships to promote a sustainable future.
